abstract: Many countries, joined by coalition of nongovernmental organizations, are calling for more transparency in selection process for secretary general of United Nations; say old method, wherein Security Council secretively chooses one nominee for General Assembly to rubber-stamp, is outdated.
lead_paragraph: Frustrated with the dominance of the five world powers, other countries are calling for a more transparent selection process and the appointment of a woman to lead the United Nations.

headline.main: United Nations Members Push to Open Search Process for Next Chief
headline.print_headline: U.N. Members Push to Open Search Process for Next Chief
headline.seo: U.N. Members Push for Transparency in Selection of Next Chief

snippet: Frustrated with the dominance of the five world powers, other countries are calling for a more transparent selection process and the appointment of a woman to lead the United Nations.
